snippet: The Big East commissioner says an Atlantic Coast Conference tournament in Brooklyn would be good for her league, which is remaking itself after several tumultuous seasons.
abstract: William C Rhoden Sports of The Times column; Big East commissioner Val Ackerman says she does not feel threatened by plans to bring the Atlantic Coast Conference men's basketball tournament to Brooklyn's Barclay's Center in 2017 and 2018; holds that market is large enough that the ACC tournament will not detract from Big East competition at Madison Square Garden.
lead_paragraph: The Big East commissioner says an Atlantic Coast Conference tournament in Brooklyn would be good for her league, which is remaking itself after several tumultuous seasons.

headline.main: Rebuilt Big East Sees Room for a Rival Conference’s Tournament
headline.print_headline: Rebuilt Big East Sees Room for a Rival Conference’s Tournament
